comment: Users retain the rights to the content they share, but grant Instagram license to use and modify that content within the service.  While photograhs themselves belong to users, I don't think this is a resource produced by Instagram, but is produced prior to circulation on Instagram.
photos remain the property of those who take them, but they must grant IG/FB a non-exclusive right to do whatever they want with them.

This is one of those cases in which Instagram does not claim ownership over content but because of the nature of its service it requires users to grant them a limited licensing agreement that allows them to display and modify content on or off the site/app. If a user's setting are on private, this limited licensing does not aply.
